    this should separate white to (only if the player has 2 white to cards) and discount the only 2 LCards that could be "deactivated" (only discount technically)

    updates the black cross image based on the value of Lorenzo's position

    visualize the board passed like parameter
    void updateCardMatrix()
    based on the client cards this function shows the top card of each pile, obscures the card if pile's empty
    void updateDiscountsExtraProd()
    checks if the discount leader card is clicked and if it is shows a green arrow that tell's the player that the discount pointed is active, due to the fact that it could also be deactivated
    void updateFaithPath()
    updates the red cross image based on the value of the player's faithpath position
    void updateLCards()
    updates the LCard zone, filling the rectangle with green if active, setting the back if discarded
    void updatePending()
    shows which resources you got from the resource market
    void updatePickedRes()
    function that updates the value of the resource currently picked
    void updatePopeFavor()
    based on the value got by the pope favor map's Client model load a new image if active or remove image if discarded
    void updateResMarket()
    based on the marble's list, the function shows the marble's market
    void updateSlots()
    update the slots from the client model
    void updateStrongbox()
    function that updates every resource in the strongbox with it's value
    void updateToggledProduction()
    checks if in the list of active productions there's one of the production in the board's slots
    void updateUnknown()
    graphic update of the unknown resource based on which resource is clicked
    void updateWarehouse()
    function that will update the result of the drag and drop event in the warehouse
    void whiteTo​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent event)
    the drag of a white marble into the card transforms that marble into a specific resource, this function is needed when there are 2 whiteTo active so there must be a choice between them

      public java.lang.String countPending​(java.util.List<Resource> pending, Resource check)

      Parameters:
      pending - a list of resources
      check - a Resource useful to iterate through the pending list
      Returns:
      the number of pending resources as a string, that will be set in a specific Label

    • placeWarehouse

      public void placeWarehouse​(javafx.scene.input.DragEvent dragEvent)
      based on the drag event target, which is an empty Imageview that will be updated in future, i'll assign a value to a integer slot. This slot identifies the warehouse position of the dropped pending resource.
      Parameters:
      dragEvent - this event identifies the end of a drag and drop event

    • movePendingRes

      public void movePendingRes​(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      the function, based on where the drag event starts saves on the clipboard the relative image (to be later placed in the warehouse) and assigns to a global variable, useful to the deposit message, the kind of resource i'm try to deposit
      Parameters:
      mouseEvent - detects the drag event

      Returns:
